methodsynopsis.sdesc: Process the specified HTTP request, and create the corresponding HTTP response (or forward to another web component that will create it).
methodsynopsis.desc: Return an 1 ActionForward instance describing where and how control should be forwarded, or 1 null if the response has already been completed.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Process the specified HTTP request, and create the corresponding HTTP response (or forward to another web component that will create it).
methodsynopsis.desc: Return an 1 ActionForward instance describing where and how control should be forwarded, or 1 null if the response has already been completed.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Process the specified HTTP request, and create the corresponding HTTP response (or forward to another web component that will create it), with provision for handling exceptions thrown by the business logic.
methodsynopsis.desc: Override this method in an extended Action class (eg: LoginAction) to define business class logic. This method is called from RequestProcessor to process an HTTP or HTTPS request.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Return the ActionServer controller instance to which we are attached.
The context attributes key under which our instance will be stored.

Save the specified error messages keys into the appropriate request attribute for use by the <phpmvc:errors> handler, if any messages are required. Otherwise, ensure that the request attribute is not created.

Save the specified FormBean object into the appropriate request attribute for use by the template resource, if a FormBean object as required. Otherwise, ensure that the request attribute is not created.

Save the specified ValueObject (business data) object into the appropriate request attribute for use by the template resource, if a ValueObject object as required. Otherwise, ensure that the request attribute is not created.
Set the ActionServer controller instance to which we are attached (if is non-null), or release any allocated resources (if is NULL).

This method will return 1 NULL if this form's enctype is not "multipart/request-data".

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Reset all bean properties to their default state. This method is called before the properties are repopulated by the controller servlet.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Reset all bean properties to their default state. This method is called before the properties are repopulated by the controller servlet.
methodsynopsis.desc: The default implementation does nothing. Subclasses should override this method to reset all bean properties to default values.

and return an object that encapsulates any validation errors that have been found. If no errors are found, return 1 NULL or an object with no recorded error messages.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Validate the properties that have been set for this HTTP request,
methodsynopsis.desc:
and return an object that encapsulates any validation errors that have been found. If no errors are found, return 1 null or an object with no recorded error messages.

The default ipmlementation performs no validation and returns 1 null. Subclasses must override this method to provide any validation they wish to perform.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Return an individual message string related to a specific property.
methodsynopsis.desc: If there is no such message, a NULL string is returned.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Return 1 true if there are no messages recorded in this collection, or 1 false otherwise.
methodsynopsis.desc: Note: empty() is a PHP reserved function name (original Strust method name was "empty()"

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Return the set of property names for which at least one message has been recorded. If there are no messages, an empty Iterator is returned.
methodsynopsis.desc: If you have recorded global messages, the String value of 1 . will be one of the returned property names.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Return the number of messages associated with the specified property.
Return the set of all recorded messages, without distinction by which property the messages are associated with. If there are no messages recorded, an empty enumeration is returned.

methodsynopsis.desc: PlugIn objects are created and configured in a similar manner to a standard Rule by the configuration Digester ObjectCreateRule object. The PlugIns are stored to the ApplicationConfig object and can be retrieved here.A reference to the PlugIn object is saved to the ActionServer->plugIns array keyed by the PlugIn key value.Retrieve a reference to a PlugIn like this: $myPlugIn =& $this->actionServer->getPlugIn("MY_PLUGIN_KEY");

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Setup an Digester XML application configuration processor
methodsynopsis.desc: Create (if needed) and return a new Digester instance that has been initialized to process php.MVC application configuraiton files and configure a corresponding ApplicationConfig object (which must be pushed on to the evaluation stack before parsing begins).

DispatchAction This class maps a form button value to the required method name.
methodsynopsis.desc:
Eg: submit button [addToCart] maps to TestDispatchAction->addToCart(...)

To use descriptive button names ([Add Item]), see class LookupDispatchAction

methodsynopsis.sdesc: ForwardAction
methodsynopsis.desc: A php.MVC framework class we can use when we don't require any business logic processing. This class provides a generic execute() method.This will forward control to the context-relative URI specified by the 'parameter' attribute of the <action ... parameter = "myPage.php">.Program execution will terminate in RequestProcessor->process(...)Note: A regular Action class would return a Forward object and continue program execution.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: LookupDispatchAction Extends DispatchAction to allow descriptive names on the submit buttons.
methodsynopsis.desc: This class maps the descriptive name to the required method name. Eg: submit button [Add Item] maps to TestLookupDispatchAction->addToCart(...)

methodsynopsis.desc: This method sets properties on the PlugIn driver instance and properties on the PlugIn module instance.If plug-in element attributes "className" or "key" are found, they are mapped to methods 1 () and 1 () on the PlugIn driver.If the plug-in element contains 1 <set-property .../> elements, class variables on the PlugIn module instance are set. For example, the following set-property element 1 <set-property property="force_compile" value="False"/> would result in the PlugIn instance variable "force_compile" being set to "True".Override this method in the concrete PlugIn wrapper class to provide application specific behavior as required.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Receive notification that this application is shutting down.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Return a String representation of this object.
Add a new custom configuration property.
methodsynopsis.desc: First we look for a setter method matching the $name parameter. For example "host" would become setHost($value). These setter methods would normally be the data-source attributes. Something like: 1 <data-source ="PEAR_MYSQL_DATA_SETUP" ="PearMysqlDataSource">If a setter method is not found, set the property/value as a custom property on properties array. These properties would be defined in the set-property elements of the particular data-source element. Something like: <set-property property="host" value="localhost"/>Tech note: This behavour varies from the way properties are set on other configuration classes. In those cases we set all properties via the object setter methods. For the DataSourceConfig object we add the custom properties to the 1 $this-> as shown above. The properties array is used in 1 ->initApplicationDataSources(...) to populate the DataSourceDriver instance, e.g. 1 ="PearMysqlDataSource".

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Freeze the configuration of this data source.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Set the path to the static resource.
methodsynopsis.desc: The path string is decoded with urldecode(). This is necessary to handle request redirect paths that contain "&" separator characters. For example: 1 <forward2 = "redirect_path"3 = "http://www.myhost.com/myapp/Main.php?do=myAction&cmd=listItems"4 = "true"/>The XML processor will not accept character data strings containing the "&" character, and PHP will not correctly handle query strings with the hex replacement character "%26". So we decode (un-hex) the path string here.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Return a String representation of this object.
Remove an element from an array, including the key.
methodsynopsis.desc: Returns 1 True if the key was found in the array , or 1 False if the key is not found in the array. (Concept contributed by: mschmitz - Michael) Usage: HelperUtils::zapArrayElement('key', $myArray);

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Performs the HTTP GET operation; the default implementation reports an HTTP BAD_REQUEST error.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Was this request received on a secure connection?

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Release all object references, and initialize instance variables, in preparation for reuse of this object.
Set the appServerPath path for this Request. This will normally be called when the associated Context is mapping the Request to a particular Wrapper.
Set a FILES request variable array to the Request object.
Set a GET request variable array to the Request object.
Set the HTTP request method used for this Request.
Set the path information for this Request. This will normally be called when the associated Context is mapping the Request to a particular Wrapper.
Set a POST request variable array to the Request object.

Add the specified Cookie to those that will be included with this Response.
Flush the buffer and commit this response. If this is the first output, send the HTTP headers prior to the user data.
methodsynopsis.desc: To-Do

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Return an array of all cookies set for this response, or a zero-length array if no cookies have been set.

Return the value for the specified header, or 1 null if this header has not been set. If more than one value was added for this name, only the first is returned; use getHeaderValues() to retrieve all of them.
Returns a default status message for the specified HTTP status code.
Release all object references, and initialize instance variables, in preparation for reuse of this object.
Clear all cookies and headers and reset the message and status
Send the HTTP response headers, if this has not already occurred.
Set the content type for this Response.
Set the specified header to the specified value.
Set the specified integer header to the specified value.
Set the Locale that is appropriate for this response, including setting the appropriate character encoding.
Creates a new locale for the given language and country.
Convert new iso639 codes to the old ones.
Compares two locales. To be equal, obj must be a Locale with the same language, country, and variant code.
methodsynopsis.desc: Returns True if obj is equal to $this

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Returns the list of available locales.
Returns the country code of this locale ("AU"), or an empty String.

Returns the default Locale. The default locale is generally once set on start up and then never changed. Normally you should use this locale for everywhere you need a locale. The initial setting matches the default locale, the user has chosen.
Returns the country name of this locale localized to the
methodsynopsis.desc:
default locale. If the localized is not found, the ISO code is returned. This has the same effect as getDisplayCountry(Locale::getDefault());

Returns the country name of this locale localized to the given locale, with the ISO code as backup

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Gets the language name suitable for display to the user, formatted for a specified locale.
methodsynopsis.desc: Returns the language name of this locale localized to the given locale, with the ISO code as backup

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Gets all local components suitable for display to the user, formatted
methodsynopsis.desc:
for a specified locale. For the language component, getDisplayLanguage(Locale) is called. For the country component, getDisplayCountry(Locale) is called. For the variant set component, getDisplayVariant(Locale) is called.

The returned String will be one of the following forms: language (country, variant) language (country) language (variant) country (variant) language country variant

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Returns the variant name of this locale localized to the given locale. If the localized is not found, the variant code itself is returned.
Returns the three-letter ISO country abbrevation of the locale.
Returns the three-letter ISO language abbrevation of this locale.
Returns a String array of all 2-letter uppercase country codes as defined in ISO 3166.
Returns a String array of all 2-letter lowercase language codes as defined in ISO 639 (both old and new variant).
Returns the language code of this locale ("en"), or an empty String. Some language codes have changed as ISO 639 has evolved; this returns the old name, even if you built the locale with the new one.
Returns the variant code of this locale, or an empty String.
Return the hash code for this locale. The hashcode is the logical xor of the hash codes of the language, the country and the variant.
methodsynopsis.desc: The hash code is precomputed, since s are often used in hash tables.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Changes the default locale. Normally only called on program start up.
methodsynopsis.desc: Note that this doesn't change the locale for other programs. This has a security check, 1 PropertyPermission("user.language", "write"), because of its potential impact to running code.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Gets the string representation of the current locale. This consists of the language, the country, and the variant, separated by an underscore.
methodsynopsis.desc: The variant is listed only if there is a language or country. Examples: "en", "de_DE", "_GB", "en_US_WIN", "de__POSIX", "fr__MAC".

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Process the specified HTTP request, and create the corresponding HTTP response (or forward to another web component that will create it).
methodsynopsis.desc: Return an 1 ActionForward instance describing where and how control should be forwarded, or 1 null if the response has already been completed.Note: This method was named perform(). perform() is depreciated and replaced with execute()

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Provides the mapping from resource key to method name
Convert all HTML entities to their applicable characters.
methodsynopsis.desc:
Returns the string text with replaced html entities.

Note: This method provides the same functionality like 'html_entity_decode()' (PHP 4 >= 4.3.0, PHP 5), but the method 'unhtmlentities()' works even with prior versions of PHP.

Author: Michael Schmitz - http://sourceforge.net/users/mschmitz/

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Format the message pattern by replacing the {0}-{3} parameters with the corresponding args array parameters. Returns the formatted message string.
methodsynopsis.desc: Usage: call the MessageFormat constructor with the pattern to process as the argument. Eg: new MessageFormat("This is my {0} post for week {1}"). Then call the format method with the replacement parameters in the args array Eg: $format->format( array('First', 'Five') ). Development note: Check strtr(...), may be faster then str_replace() ! $trans = array("hello" => "hi", "hi" => "hello"); echo strtr("hi all, I said hello", $trans) . "\n"; This will show: "hello all, I said hi",

methodsynopsis.desc: Implementation note: PEAR::HTTP_Upload class uses global $HTTP_POST_FILES, $HTTP_SERVER_VARS. So parameters "&$request" and, "$config" are not used in this implementation.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Retrieves all the UploadFileForm input elements of the request.
methodsynopsis.desc:
Returns an array where the keys are the input names of the files and the values are FormFile objects.

If the fileElements array is empty, call makeFileElements() to build the array.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Gets the maximum post data size in bytes from the string representation in the controller element of the XML configuration file.
methodsynopsis.desc: The string can be expressed as a number followed by a "K", "M", or "G", which are interpreted to mean kilobytes, megabytes, or gigabytes, respectively. For example: the string "250M" would be converted to the integer 262144000 (250*1024*1024).Returns an integer derived from the string file size parameter.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Returns a reference to the PEAR::HTTP_Upload class
Build an array of UploadedFile objects representing the form files uploaded, here the keys are the input names of the files and the values are UploadedFile objects.

methodsynopsis.desc: Returns Filename on success or Pear_Error object on error.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Move the uploaded files to another location.
methodsynopsis.desc: Returns an array of operation status (error) messages. Each array element represents the return value of the native PEAR HTTP_Upload moveTo() operation: Filename on success or Pear_Error object on error.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Reset the FileElement array

methodsynopsis.desc: implementation, the property should contain a fully qualified package and resource name, separated by periods, of a series of property resources to be loaded from the class loader that created this PropertyMessageResources instance.We try to load the most specific resource first. Eg: 1) 'en_AU_QL' - most specific 2) 'en_AU' 3) 'en' 4) '' - default appServer Locale

methodsynopsis.desc: (LocalStringsTest_ll_CC.properties) (No users Locale settings) Test 1: No replacement parameters Test 2: One replacement parameter Test 3: Test fallback to less specific locale files (language file) Test 4: Test fallback to less specific locale files (default base file) Test 5: Message key not found in any property file.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Test the users prefered Locale. (LocalStringsTest_ii_CC.properties)
methodsynopsis.desc: (LocalStringsTest_ll_CC.properties) Test 1: No replacement parameters Test 2: One replacement parameter Test 3: Test fallback to less specific locale files (language file) Test 4: Test fallback to less specific locale files (default base file) Test 5: Message key not found in any property file.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Test the default AppServer Locale. (LocalStringsTest.properties)
methodsynopsis.desc: (No users Locale settings) Test 1: No replacement parameters Test 2: One replacement parameter Test 3: Four (max) replacement parameters Test 4: Message key not found in any property file.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Test the default AppServer language Locale.
methodsynopsis.desc: (LocalStringsTest_ll.properties) (No users Locale settings) Test 1: No replacement parameters Test 2: One replacement parameter Test 3: Test fallback to less specific locale files Test 4: Message key not found in any property file.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Test the users prefered Locale. (LocalStringsTest_ll.properties)
methodsynopsis.desc: (LocalStringsTest_ll.properties) (No users Locale settings) Test 1: No replacement parameters Test 2: One replacement parameter Test 3: Test fallback to less specific locale files Test 4: Message key not found in any property file.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Test loading a property file from a FQDN domain directory path.
methodsynopsis.desc: For example: 'phpmvc.com/MyAppResources' => "phpmvc.com/MyAppResources.properties". Note: The "." characters will NOT be transformed to "/"

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Test loading a property file from a domain directory path.
methodsynopsis.desc: For example: 'com.phpmvc.MyAppResources' => "com/phpmvc/MyAppResources.properties". Note: The "." characters will be transformed to "/"Note: If the property file path contains any slash characters, we assume this is a fully qualified domain name path and leave the path as-is. Eg: './phpmvc.com\MyAppResources' If the property file path does not contains any slash characters, we assume this is a Java/Struts type domain name scheme and replace all '.' characters with '/' characters. Eg: 'com.phpmvc.MyAppResources'

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Test message caching (two identical messages !!!!!!!)
methodsynopsis.desc: Test 1: Not really a test, just a reminder to check the MessageFormat caching

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Test (ignore) comments in property files as per the java.util.Properties.load() documentation.
methodsynopsis.desc: Test 1: A valid comment line Test 2: A comment line using the "#" character Test 3: A comment line using the "!" character

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Test the default AppServer language_COUNTRY_VARIANT Locale.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Test the users prefered language_COUNTRY_VARIANT Locale.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Add a Locale to the set of preferred Locales for this Request. The first added Locale will be the first one returned by getLocales().
Perform whatever actions are required to flush and close the input stream or reader, in a single operation.
Return the specified request attribute if it exists; otherwise, return 1 NULL.
Return the names of all request attributes for this Request, or an empty 1 Enumeration if there are none.
Return the authorization credentials sent with this request.
Return the character encoding for this Request.
Return the content length for this Request.
Return the content type for this Request.
Return the Context within which this Request is being processed.
Return descriptive information about this Request implementation and the corresponding version number, in the format 1 <description>/<version>.

Return the preferred Locale that the client will accept content in, based on the value for the first 1 Accept-Language header that was encountered. If the request did not specify a preferred language, the server's default Locale is returned.

Return the set of preferred Locales that the client will accept content in, based on the values for any 1 Accept-Language headers that were encountered. If the request did not specify a preferred language, the server's default Locale is returned.
Return the value of the specified request parameter, if any; otherwise, return 1 null. If there is more than one value defined, return only the first one.
methodsynopsis.desc: Abstract

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Returns a 1 Map of the parameters of this request.
methodsynopsis.desc:
Request parameters are extra information sent with the request. For HTTP servlets, parameters are contained in the query string or posted form data.

Abstract

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Return the names of all defined request parameters for this request.
methodsynopsis.desc: Abstract

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Return the defined values for the specified request parameter, if any; otherwise, return 1 NULL.
methodsynopsis.desc: Abstract

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Return the protocol and version used to make this Request.
Return the remote IP address making this Request.
Return the remote host name making this Request.
Return the 1 Server Request for which this object is the facade. This method must be implemented by a subclass.
Return a RequestDispatcher that wraps the resource at the specified path, which may be interpreted as relative to the current request path.
methodsynopsis.desc: Abstract

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Return the Response with which this Request is associated.
Return the scheme used to make this Request.
Return the server name responding to this Request.
Return the server port responding to this Request.

Was this request received on a secure connection?
Release all object references, and initialize instance variables, in preparation for reuse of this object.
Remove the specified request attribute if it exists.
Set the specified request attribute to the specified value.
Set the authorization credentials sent with this request.
Overrides the name of the character encoding used in the body of this request. This method must be called prior to reading request parameters or reading input using 1 getReader().
Set the content length associated with this Request.
Set the content type (and optionally the character encoding) associated with this Request. For example, 1 text/html; charset=ISO-8859-4.

Set the Context within which this Request is being processed. This must be called as soon as the appropriate Context is identified, because it identifies the value to be returned by 1 (), and thus enables parsing of the request URI.
Set the protocol name and version associated with this Request.
Set the IP address of the remote client associated with this Request.
Set the fully qualified name of the remote client associated with this Request.
Set the Response with which this Request is associated.
Set the name of the scheme associated with this request. Typical values are 1 http, 1 https, and 1 ftp.
Set the value to be returned by 1 () for this Request.
Set the name of the server (virtual host) to process this request.
Set the port number of the server to process this request.

Set the Wrapper within which this Request is being processed. This must be called as soon as the appropriate Wrapper is identified, and before the Request is ultimately passed to an application servlet.
Clean up in preparation for a shutdown of this application.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Return the debugging detail level that has been configured for our ActionServer controller
Return the instance containing our internal message strings.
Return the ServletContext for the web application we are running in.
Initialize this request processor instance.
Log the specified message and exception to the servlet context log for this web application.
Process an 1 HttpServletRequest and create the corresponding 1 HttpServletResponse.
Examine this instance to determine if a path to another Action resource (an Action chain) has been set.
Return an instance that will be used to process the current request, creating a new one if necessary.
Forward or redirect to the specified destination, by the specified mechanism.
methodsynopsis.desc: A "forward" request is handled within the current processor. The RequestProcessor simply passes control to the ActionDispatcher, which "includes" the specified URI (page/template). This is the default behavour: <forward name="forward_path path="/phpmvc-test/TestMVC/Main.php?do=forwardRequest" redirect="false"/>A "redirect" request actually sends the client (browser) a header response redirecting the client to a new URL. Execution of the current process terminates immediately on sending the request redirect header to the client. <!-- This server --> <forward name="redirect_path path="/phpmvc-test/MyApp/Main.php?do=newRequest" redirect="true"/>or <!-- This server, or a remote server --> <forward name="redirect_path path="http://www.myhost.com/MyApp/Main.php?do=newRequest" redirect="true"/>

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Ask the specified instance to handle this request. Return the 1 ActionForward instance (if any) returned by the called for further processing, or NULL if using the ForwardAction class.

Set the default content type (with optional character encoding) for all responses if requested. NOTE - This header will be overridden automatically if a 1 RequestDispatcher.forward() call is ultimately invoked.
Process a forward requested by this mapping (if any). Return 1 true if standard processing should continue, or 1 false if we have already handled this request.
Process an include requested by this mapping (if any). Return 1 true if standard processing should continue, or 1 false if we have already handled this request.
Select the mapping used to process the selection path for this request.
methodsynopsis.desc: If no mapping can be identified, create an error response and return 1 NULL.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: If this is a multipart request, wrap it with a special wrapper.
methodsynopsis.desc: Otherwise, return the request unchanged.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Set the no-cache headers for all responses, if requested.
methodsynopsis.desc: NOTE - This header will be overridden automatically if a 1 RequestDispatcher.forward() call is ultimately invoked.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Identify and return the path component (from the request URI) that we will use to select an ActionMapping to dispatch with. If no such path can be identified, create an error response and return 1 NULL.
Populate the properties of the specified ActionForm instance from the request parameters included with this request.

General-purpose preprocessing hook that can be overridden as required by subclasses. Return 1 true if you want standard processing to continue, or 1 false if the response has already been completed. The default implementation does nothing.

If this action is protected by security roles, make sure that the current user possesses at least one of them. Return 1 true to continue normal processing, or 1 false if an appropriate response has been created and processing should terminate.
Call the 1 validate() method of the specified ActionForm,
methodsynopsis.desc: and forward back to the input form if there are any errors. Return 1 true if we should continue processing, or return 1 false if we have already forwarded control back to the input form.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Return a new instance of the specified class name, after loading the class from this web application's class loader.
methodsynopsis.desc: The specified class MUST have a public zero-arguments constructor.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Create (if necessary) and return an ActionForm instance appropriate for this request. If no ActionForm instance is required, return 1 null.
Return the list of sub-application prefixes that are defined for this web application, creating it if necessary. NOTE - the "" prefix for the default application is not included in this list.

Try to locate a multipart request handler for this request. First, look for a mapping-specific handler stored for us under an attribute. If one is not present, use the global multipart handler, if there is one.
methodsynopsis.desc: Returns the multipart handler to use, or 1 NULL if none is found.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Populate the properties of the specified Bean from the specified
methodsynopsis.desc:
HTTP request, based on matching each parameter name (plus an optional prefix and/or suffix) against the corresponding Beans "property setter" methods in the bean's class. Suitable conversion is done for argument types as described under 1 setProperties().

If you specify a non-null 1 prefix and a non-null 1 suffix, the parameter name must match both conditions for its value(s) to be used in populating bean properties. If the request's content type is "multipart/form-data" and the method is "POST", the HttpRequest object will be wrapped in a MultipartRequestWrapper object.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Return the URL representing the current request. This is equivalent to 1 HttpServletRequest.getRequestURL() in Servlet 2.3.
Select the sub-application to which the specified request belongs, and add corresponding request attributes to this request.
Return the URL representing the scheme, server, and port number of the current request. Server-relative URLs can be created by simply appending the server-relative path (starting with '/') to this.
